Outbreak or escalation of armed conflict in a country hosting critical suppliers, manufacturing facilities, or sourcing operations, causing supply disruption, facility damage, or inability to operate.
Imposition of comprehensive or targeted international sanctions, trade embargoes, or economic restrictions affecting ability to conduct business with sanctioned entities, countries, or sectors.
Government seizure or forced nationalization of foreign-owned assets, facilities, or operations, either through outright expropriation or de facto control measures.
Strikes, protests, riots, or civil unrest disrupting facilities, supply chains, or workforce availability for >48 hours, causing material operational impact.
Collapse of state institutions, regime change, or extreme political instability causing breakdown of rule of law, contract enforceability, or operational environment.
Armed territorial disputes, contested borders, or sea lane control issues disrupting trade routes, energy corridors, or supply chain access.
Large-scale military mobilization, conscription, or reserve call-ups removing significant workforce from operations in conflict or near-conflict zones.
Imposition of tariffs exceeding 25% on significant trade volumes, affecting cost structure, competitiveness, or market access for EU businesses.
Government-imposed restrictions on exporting critical technologies, dual-use goods, or strategic materials, limiting market access or requiring costly compliance.
Government-imposed restrictions on currency convertibility, capital repatriation, foreign exchange access, or cross-border payments, impeding financial operations.
Termination, suspension, or non-renewal of bilateral/multilateral trade agreements, resulting in loss of preferential market access, tariff increases, or regulatory barriers.
New or tightened import quotas, licensing requirements, or quantitative restrictions limiting ability to import goods or requiring costly compliance processes.
Sanctions imposed on key business partners (customers, suppliers, partners) requiring immediate relationship termination and causing supply/revenue disruption.
New or significantly tightened environmental regulations on emissions (GHG, air quality), waste management, circular economy, or pollution control, requiring operational changes or investments.
New or expanded data protection/privacy regulations similar to GDPR, requiring significant compliance investments, operational changes, or restricting data use/transfers.
Changes to product safety standards, certification requirements, or testing protocols requiring product redesign, re-certification, or market withdrawals.
Significant changes to labor laws affecting wages, working hours, benefits, or employment rights, increasing labor costs or constraining operational flexibility.
Major changes to financial reporting standards (e.g., IFRS), tax codes, transfer pricing rules, or anti-avoidance measures, requiring system changes and potentially increasing tax burdens.
Mandatory supply chain due diligence requirements (human rights, environmental, conflict minerals) requiring transparency, audits, and potential supplier changes.
New restrictions on chemicals, materials, or substances (similar to REACH, RoHS) requiring product reformulation, alternative sourcing, or market withdrawals.
Recession in major market (GDP contraction >2%)
Banking crisis or credit crunch
Currency devaluation (>30% vs. USD/EUR)
Sovereign debt crisis
Inflation surge (>10% annually)
Asset bubble burst (real estate, stocks)
Carbon pricing/tax implementation
Fossil fuel subsidy removal
Renewable energy mandates
Internal combustion engine phase-out
Building energy efficiency requirements
Green hydrogen/ammonia transition

Event_Name: Semiconductor / Advanced Technology Export Control Expansion
Event_Description: Semiconductor / Advanced Technology Export Control Expansion

Event_Name: AI Regulation / Algorithmic Compliance Requirements (EU AI Act)
Event_Description: AI Regulation / Algorithmic Compliance Requirements (EU AI Act)
Data Protection & Localization Mandates (GDPR, Schrems)

Event_Name: Forced Technology Transfer / Local Partnering Requirements
Event_Description: Forced Technology Transfer / Local Partnering Requirements
Critical Technology Investment Screening (FDI/CFIUS)
SWIFT or payment system exclusion
Foreign exchange market closure

Event_Name: Credit market freeze (no access to financing)
Event_Description: Credit market freeze (no access to financing)
Insurance market withdrawal (uninsurable risks)
Securities market suspension
Ransomware attack encrypting healthcare IT systems (EHR, patient records, scheduling) causing patient care disruption ≥24 hours
Unauthorized access to industrial control systems (SCADA, DCS, PLC) in manufacturing, causing production disruption, safety incident, or data theft
Cyber-attack on electrical grid infrastructure, causing power outages, grid instability, or control system compromise affecting ≥10,000 customers
Cyber compromise of water treatment, distribution, or wastewater control systems causing service disruption, contamination risk, or environmental incident
Cyber incident affecting rail signaling, traffic management, airport operations, or mass transit control systems, causing safety incidents or >4-hour service disruption
Unauthorized cyber access to nuclear power plant, chemical manufacturing, or other high-hazard facility control systems, even if no physical impact occurred
Ransomware attack encrypting core business systems (ERP, CRM, financial systems) causing operational disruption ≥24 hours
Direct attack on databases (SQL, NoSQL, backups) causing data loss, corruption, or encryption requiring restoration from backups
Ransomware attack combining encryption with data exfiltration and threat to publicly leak sensitive data unless ransom paid
Unauthorized access or theft of customer personal data (names, emails, addresses, payment info) triggering GDPR Article 33/34 notification requirements
Cyber espionage targeting proprietary information: product designs, formulas, source code, R&D data, manufacturing processes
Theft of payment card data, bank account information, or financial credentials through cyber-attack on payment systems or databases
Theft of employee login credentials, Active Directory compromise, or domain admin account takeover enabling lateral movement
Data breach or security incident at third-party vendor/partner exposing company data stored in partner systems

Event_Name: Third-party software supply chain attack (e.g., SolarWinds)
Event_Description: Malicious code inserted into legitimate software updates or packages, distributed to customers through trusted software supply chain
Cyber-attack on managed IT service provider, using their privileged access to customer systems to deploy malware or ransomware
Critical vulnerability or malicious code in open-source software library used by company applications (direct or transitive dependency)
Security breach at cloud/SaaS provider exposing customer data or enabling unauthorized access to customer environments
Critical SaaS application vulnerability or breach enabling unauthorized access to customer data or enabling downstream attacks
Social engineering attack impersonating executives or vendors to authorize fraudulent wire transfers or sensitive data disclosure
Fraudulent modification of vendor payment instructions or fake invoices leading to misdirected payments
Sophisticated phishing attack defeating MFA through adversary-in-the-middle (AitM), push notification fatigue, or MFA interception
Use of AI-generated voice or video (deep fake) to impersonate executives or trusted individuals to authorize transactions or disclose information

Event_Name: Volumetric DDoS attack (>100 Gbps causing material disruption)
Event_Description: Large-scale distributed denial-of-service attack exceeding 100 Gbps or 1M packets/second, causing website/service unavailability >4 hours
DDoS attack combined with extortion demand (typically 1-5 Bitcoin ransom); often application-layer attacks targeting specific services
Attack on DNS infrastructure or BGP route hijacking redirecting traffic to attacker-controlled servers or causing service unavailability

Event_Name: Hyperscaler vendor lock-in / Migration barriers (proprietary services, egress costs)
Event_Description: Technical or economic inability to migrate workloads from current cloud provider due to proprietary services, egress costs, or architectural dependencies

Event_Name: Cloud service provider outage / Service degradation (≥4hr, multi-region)
Event_Description: Major cloud platform outage affecting multiple regions or availability zones, causing service unavailability ≥4 hours

Event_Name: Cloud pricing shock / Cost escalation (>30% YoY increase)
Event_Description: Unexpected cloud cost increases >30% year-over-year due to pricing changes, usage growth, or cloud "bill shock" from uncontrolled consumption

Event_Name: Data residency / Sovereignty compliance failure (GDPR, Schrems)
Event_Description: Discovery that customer personal data is stored or processed in jurisdictions violating GDPR, Schrems II rulings, or other data sovereignty requirements

Event_Name: Platform dependency / API deprecation (Maps, payment, critical APIs)
Event_Description: Critical third-party platform APIs deprecated, pricing changed dramatically, or access restricted, requiring application rearchitecture

Event_Name: National cloud / Data center capacity shortage
Event_Description: Insufficient cloud or data center capacity in preferred jurisdiction (e.g., EU, specific country) forcing suboptimal deployment choices

Event_Name: Advanced semiconductor access restriction (<7nm chips, AI accelerators)
Event_Description: Export controls, allocation constraints, or geopolitical restrictions limiting access to advanced semiconductors (<7nm process nodes, AI GPUs, HBM memory)

Event_Name: Semiconductor supply chain disruption (fab fire, earthquake, geopolitics)
Event_Description: Major disruption to semiconductor manufacturing from fab accidents, natural disasters, or geopolitical events affecting multiple industries

Event_Name: Legacy chip / Mature node shortage (automotive MCUs, industrial)
Event_Description: Shortage of mature-node semiconductors (>28nm) used in automotive, industrial, and IoT applications, despite ample advanced-chip capacity

Event_Name: Hardware supply chain attack / Compromised components
Event_Description: Discovery of malicious hardware (chips, firmware, components) in supply chain, requiring product recalls and supply chain forensics

Event_Name: Critical equipment / Manufacturing tools shortage (SME, machine tools, robots, test equipment)
Event_Description: Shortage or extended lead times (>12 months) for critical manufacturing equipment: semiconductor manufacturing equipment (SME), CNC machine tools, industrial robots, test equipment

Event_Name: Industrial automation hardware dependency / Vendor lock-in (PLCs, SCADA, DCS, HMI, MES)
Event_Description: Proprietary industrial control system hardware creating migration barriers, limiting vendor competition, and imposing long-term costs/constraints

Event_Name: Machine tool / Critical manufacturing equipment access restriction
Event_Description: Export controls, geopolitical restrictions, or supply allocation limiting access to advanced machine tools (5-axis CNC, EDM, precision grinding, additive manufacturing)

Event_Name: Critical software license termination / Access restriction (ERP, CAD/EDA, OS)
Event_Description: Loss of access to critical business software due to license termination, sanctions, vendor bankruptcy, or pricing prohibiting continued use

Event_Name: Open-source software maintainer risk / Supply chain failure (Log4j scenario)
Event_Description: Critical open-source software project with single/few maintainers faces abandonment, burnout, compromise, or inability to address critical vulnerabilities

Event_Name: AI/ML platform dependency / Model access restriction (OpenAI, NVIDIA CUDA)
Event_Description: Dependency on proprietary AI/ML platforms (OpenAI API, Google Vertex AI, NVIDIA CUDA) facing pricing changes, access restrictions, or service disruptions
Compromised training data or adversarial inputs causing AI/ML model to produce incorrect, biased, or malicious outputs

Event_Name: Critical software supply chain vulnerability (zero-day, widespread impact)
Event_Description: Zero-day vulnerability in widely-used software framework or library affecting thousands of applications (analogous to Log4j but proprietary software)

Event_Name: Emerging technology access restriction (quantum, 5G, advanced robotics)
Event_Description: Export controls or strategic technology restrictions limiting access to emerging technologies critical for future competitiveness

Event_Name: CAD/CAM/PLM software dependency / Vendor lock-in (industrial design software)
Event_Description: Proprietary industrial design software (CAD/CAM/PLM) creating migration barriers due to file format lock-in, training costs, and ecosystem dependencies

Event_Name: MES/SCADA/DCS software dependency (industrial control software lock-in)
Event_Description: Manufacturing Execution System (MES) and SCADA/DCS control software lock-in limiting factory digitalization and imposing long-term costs
